column4: mmm, interesting... linux-image-2.6.12-8-386 (2.6.12-8.12) to 2.6.12-8.13  <-- if you use breezy avoid updating that, seems to be broken
can you give more detail of what is broken with it?
I updated to that and am having trouble.
the windows grub boot thing is a known issue and not related to the kernel itself, but to the script that modifies the /boot/grub/menu.list after installing.
